subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Dependencies
msgSnippet: Hey, I just wanted to chime in with this bit of wisdom that took me a long time to get right: MockObjects do none of the actual work of their parents. This
messageBody:
Hey, I just wanted to chime in with this bit of wisdom that took me a
long time to get right:

MockObjects do none of the actual work of their parents.

This means, Mock databases don't do queries, mock streams don't read
from the disk, etc.

Anyway, that insight took some time for me to get, and helped me out a
lot once I understood it.

Hope this helps,

Kevin

> > The output is binary, and I'm working with streams all the way
> until
> > I actually write the file.
>
> A mock file or mock stream could be programmed to expect a specific
> sequence of bytes.
